Class Finsemble

This is the Main Class used to access Finsemble in a .NET Application. Once connected, several Finsemble APIs can be used using the SendCommand method. Connecting to Finsemble:

/*windowName, componentType and uuid are provided as command line parameters when the application is launched by Finsemble*/
var finsemble = new FinsembleBridge(openFinVersion, windowName, componentType, window, uuid);
finsemble.Connect += Finsemble_Connected;

Using the Clients once connected:

private void Finsemble_Connected(object sender, EventArgs e) {
    finsemble.SendCommand("LinkerClient.publish", new JObject {
        ["dataType"] = "symbol",
        ["data"] = "AAPL"
    });
}

Finsemble(String[], Window)

Initializes a new instance of the FinsembleBridge class. This is how you interact with Finsemble. All the clients will be part of the bridge.

RPC(String, JArray, Finsemble.RPCCallbackHandler)

Use this command to execute Finsemble API calls remotely. Specify all the arguments as a list and the callback for the callback or eventHandler.

Supported API Calls:

  • RouterClient.transmit: same as Javascript API
  • RouterClient.addListener: same as Javascript API
  • RouterClient.removeListener: same as Javascript API
  • RouterClient.publish: same as Javascript API
  • RouterClient.subscribe: does not return a subscribeID
  • RouterClient.unsubscribe: takes parameters["topic"] and the same callback that was passed to subscribe.
  • RouterClient.query: same as Javascript API
  • LinkerClient.publish: does not use the callback, does not support the channels option.
  • LinkerClient.subscribe: same as Javascript API
  • LauncherClient.spawn: same as Javascript API
  • LauncherClient.showWindow: same as Javascript API
  • ConfigClient.getValue: same as Javascript API

Declaration
public void RPC(string endpoint, JArray args, Finsemble.RPCCallbackHandler cb = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String endpoint

Name of the API call from the list above
Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JArray args

This is a JObject which contains all the parameters that the API call takes. Refer to our Javascript API for the parameters to each API call.
Finsemble.RPCCallbackHandler cb

If the API has a callback, this will be used to call back.
Examples
/* The router transmit API has two parameters, toChannel and event */
finsemble.SendRPCMessage("RouterClient.transmit", new List<JToken> {
    "channel",
    new JObject {
        ["myData"] = "myData"
    }
}, (s, args) => {});

finsemble.SendRPCMessage("RouterClient.subscribe", new List<JToken> {
    "myTopic"
}, mySubHandler);

finsemble.SendRPCMessage("RouterClient.unsubscribe", new List<JToken> {
    "myTopic"
}, mySubHandler);

/* Linker.publish takes params */
finsemble.SendCommand("LinkerClient.publish", new new List<JToken> { 
    new JObject {
        ["dataType"] = "myType",
        ["data"] = new JObject {
            ["property1"] = "property"
        }
    }
}, (s, args) => {});
